page.title: 01River Trent
page.content: Map ref 240200 The River Trent crosses the N W corner of this square.On the north bank is a meadow and on the south a belt of trees,bushes and rough grass land.South of this again is a field of barley called the Verge. In the N E corner is a section of the Stapenhill Council Estate,consisting of semi-detatched houses and streets such as Cumberland Road and Norfolk Road named after counties.The Estate is bounded on the south by the embankment of the Burton to Leicester railway,now only used by coal trains from South Derbyshire and Leicestershire collieries. The Stapenhill to Walton Lane is used by people from the Burton district who work at Drakelow Power Station.
